Finals-Games per Set: 3/5 Games for Losers Finals,3/5 Games for Winners Finals,3/5 Games for Grand Finals
Rules-Chara Change: Winner must keep character. Loser may switch.
Rules-Disconnect: In the event of a game crash or disconnect, scoring will be kept for games & rounds, and the current round will be restarted.

Region Includes:
Albania, Andorra, Armenia, Austria, Azerbaijan, Belarus, Belgium, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus (Republic of Cyprus), Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Georgia, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Italy, Ireland, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Moldova, Monaco, Montenegro, Netherlands, North Macedonia, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, San Marino, Serbia, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Ukraine, United Kingdom, Vatican City

In addition players living in European parts of these trans-continental countries are also permitted to play in the tournament:

    Kazakhstan (cut-off point is along A-28 National Highway from Uralsk to Atyrau, everything west of it is considered to be in Europe)

    Russia (cut-off point is along the Ural mountain chain, everything west of it is considered to be in Europe)

    Turkey (cut-off point is Istanbul/the Bosporus strait, everything to the north-west of Istanbul is considered to be in Europe)

Rules-Chara Change: Winner must keep character. Loser may switch.
Rules-Disconnect: In the event of a game crash or disconnect, scoring will be kept for games & rounds, and the current round will be restarted.
